DataSource.description: Query configuration for specifying a source from which data are pulled.

external_id.description: Other identifiers for this entity, eg, from the submitting study or in systems link dbGaP

google_data_project.description: The Google Data Project needed to query this snapshot in BigQuery.

parameterized_query.description: A parameterized query that contains the primary key fields and can be used to select specific rows. This should be formatted according to (https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/parameterized-queries)[BigQuery instructions], including using named parameters.

snapshot_dataset.description: The Dataset within BigQuery where the table can be queried.

snapshot_id.description: The Terra Data Repository Snapshot ID.

table.description: The table in the dataset that contains the row of interest.

DataSource.title: DataSource

age_at_last_vital_status.description: Age at last vital status in decimal years.

date_of_birth.description: Date at which the individual was born. May be impacted by privacy rules described in date_of_birth_type.

date_of_birth_type.description: Privacy rule modification applied to date_of_birth.

ethnicity.description: Reported ethnicity as defined by the 1997 OMB directives.

EnumAssertionType.description: Provides options to describe the expressed semantics of a condition.

EnumAvailabilityStatus.description: Is the Thing available for use?
EnumAvailabilityStatus.title: EnumAvailabilityStatus

EnumConditionCode.description:
Recommended ontologies include: SNOMED_CT, HP, OMIM and ORPHA, prefixed with those curies
* SNOMED : https://bioregistry.io/registry/snomedct
* HP : https://bioregistry.io/registry/hp
* OMIM : https://bioregistry.io/registry/omim
* ORPHA : https://bioregistry.io/registry/orphanet
EnumConditionCode.title: EnumConditionCode

EnumSite.description: The location of the specimen collection. Recommended ontology: [SNOMED Body Site](https://hl7.org/fhir/R4B/valueset-body-site.html)

Family.description: A group of individuals of some relation who are grouped together in the study.

consanguinity.description: Is there known or suspected consanguinity in this study family?

external_id.description: Other identifiers for this entity, eg, from the submitting study or in systems link dbGaP

family_description.description: Free title describing the study family, such as potential inheritance or details about consanguinity

anyOf.description: The family member Subject who is the relationship "subject".

family_members.description: The Subjects who are included in this family and their roles.

family_relationships.description: Family relationships associated with this family.

family_study_focus.description: What is this study family investigating? EG, a specific condition. The code should be prefixed with a recognizable curie.

family_type.description: Describes the 'type' of study family, eg, trio.

has_access_policy.description: Which access policy applies to this element?

Family.title: Family

FamilyMember.description: Designates a Subject as a member of a family with some specified role.

external_id.description: Other identifiers for this entity, eg, from the submitting study or in systems link dbGaP

family_member.description: The family member Subject who is the relationship "subject".

family_role.description: The "role" of this individual in this family. Could include terms like "proband", "mother", etc.

has_access_policy.description: Which access policy applies to this element?

FamilyMember.title: FamilyMember

family_member.description: The family member Subject who is the relationship "subject".

has_access_policy.description: Which access policy applies to this element?

other_family_member.description: The family member Subject for the relationship "object".

relationship_code.description: Code definting the relationship predicate. Relationship of the "Family Member" to the "Other Family Member" (i.e. mother, father, etc). Code must be from the HL7 [FamilyMember ValueSet](https://terminology.hl7.org/6.2.0/ValueSet-v3-FamilyMember.html)

SourceData.description: Reference to submitted data used to generate harmonized data. Applying the query_parameter(s) to the data_source.parameterized_query should return the specific data of interest.

data_source.description: Defines the location of data and how to query it.

external_id.description: Other identifiers for this entity, eg, from the submitting study or in systems link dbGaP

has_access_policy.description: Which access policy applies to this element?

query_parameter.description: One or more query parameters used to select the specific row. It will leverage the parameterized_query defined by a data_source. This should be formatted according to (https://cloud.google.com/bigquery/docs/parameterized-queries)[BigQuery instructions], specifically the bq CLI version with named parameters, ie, "<parameter name>:<data type>:<value>".

Subject.description: This entity is the subject about which data or references are recorded. | This includes the idea of a human participant in a study, a cell line, an animal model, | or any other similar entity.

subject_type.description: Type of entity this record represents

SubjectAssertion.description: Assertion about a particular Subject. May include Conditions, Measurements, etc.

age_at_assertion.description: The age in decimal years of the Subject when the assertion was made.

age_at_event.description: The age in decimal years of the Subject at the time point which the assertion describes, | eg, age of onset or when a measurement was performed.

age_at_resolution.description: The age in decimal years of the Subject when the asserted state was resolved.

assertion_type.description: The semantic type of the resource, eg, Condition.

code.description: The structured term defining the meaning of the assertion.
